meta.videoTitle: Goals Toolkit: How to Set & Achieve Your Goals

proposition: Success in pursuing goals requires defining specific actions, measurability, and specificity of those actions.
Focusing on a single priority goal increases the likelihood of success and sustained motivation.
Delineating the verbs involved in pursuing the goal contributes to higher chances of success and sustained motivation.
When setting a goal, individuals commonly have a general idea in mind.
The general idea can be wanting to be fit, proficient in a language, or wealthy.
To maximize chances of success, it is imperative to add a level of specificity to these goals.
Adding specificity means identifying the precise actions or verbs instrumental in achieving the desired outcome.
For example, instead of stating a goal as 'wanting to be fit,' it is more effective to specify the actions involved.
The specified actions may include running a certain number of miles per week or attending the gym for a specific duration.
The act of writing down your goal plays a significant role in embedding that information into your subconscious.

Defining the measurability of actions is crucial in monitoring progress and staying on track towards a goal.
Specifying the amount of time or effort dedicated to each action on a weekly basis creates tangible metrics to assess progress and make necessary adjustments.
Creating tangible metrics increases the probability of goal achievement.
Creating tangible metrics fosters a sense of accountability and commitment to the process.
